66JQyLBvYz8OFqyAyaquGg.text: Man I love this place and I love that it adds so much value to the Uptown area and lunch scene. There is nothing like Rhino Market and Deli in Uptown Charlotte unless you count Dean and Deluca which doesn't count 'cause it's a chain and it is just completely different.  if you haven't stopped in this wonderful place yet, please do. You can pick up some ground coffee from a local coffee roaster, a bottle of wine and some cheese for your after work dinner party and a damn good sandwich for lunch all in a day. They have fun gift ideas, plenty of local options and even a local beer map for purchase. All the while the best feel good music of every decade is playing. Today I heard some good ol 2000s R&b with Aaliyah throwbacks. In regards to the food, The ingredients are always fresh, the bread perfectly toasted, and the veggies bursting with color and flavor. The meat isn't too bad either, they definitely provide a healthy portion! I I cannot really compare how incredibly efficient the whole order counter, pay counter and then pick up counter are. The employees are all in sync and by the time you go to pay, you head to the pick up counter and your food is already rather quickly.  Again, please stop in if you want all all around good lunch experience and not simply just lunch.

yUKh1DOAZvX8tRJHItJfng.text: Came here with a friend for breakfast last Saturday. Great bacon egg and cheese sandwiches! Awesome atmosphere and wonderful coffee selection.

TYGm8A0qYMQHWPURx0BSrQ.text: Finally found a NY style deli in this city that works! Incredible selection, atmosphere, and the foods are incredible!!! Amazing wine/beer selection, tons of organic treats and the sandwhiches are the best I've had in a long time share mine for a deli like the NY delis I grew up with close to home back in NYC. Highly recommended.

zejfq2XfD73eNDupuMETrQ.text: Just had lunch here with my wife. The staff is as friendly as possible and the sandwiches were custom made and outstanding. Great selection of food, drinks, snacks, wine and beer. Will def be back.

KfLjjdgaW_2A200YQD7VvA.text: If I could have given this place a ZERO, I would have.  My daughter and I walked around this place for 20 minutes and not one employee spoke to us.  I live next door at the Catalyst.  I go to leave and we are chased down the street by an employee who thought we had taken their glass.  Lady, you were the bartender and cashier and you never spoke to us.  How would we have gotten your glass?  There is no level of customer service in this place!  It is a complete disappointment.

QmP7YCVNINvZfDf2YwalCQ.text: Recently had lunch here and it was great. Service was quick and friendly. I had a wrap with corn beef and it was delicious. So far best deli in Charlotte. They also have a unique selection of wine and beer. Good prices and good food! Try it!

Mlpe8DpyqzqpYzn-ElXO3Q.text: The breakfast sandwiches and locally roasted coffee is the best thing to happen to Uptown and my morning in a long time. Everything you need to start off your day with a smile. Did I mention the coffee is amazing! All local, rotating daily and with none of the coffee shop pomp.

BbXRMGo3aWGkow1mWTTPWA.text: We hit up this place for something to drink right after the Panthers game last night as we were parked in the deck right beside it. It's a cool, funky little deli with the best vibe. All should feel at home in here. They sell specialty drinks, deli items which are available late and have a bar all while playing all genres of music. I believe Ice Cube was playing last night when we walked in. We were surprised, lol. It was pretty awesome. They have a little seating other than the modest bar inside and out. The cashier girl was kind and told me that this was a new concept for her as well when she came from up north.

ut0adCC7qaKyEeAd5mRtLw.text: I love having this place across the street from work. I can eat breakfast, lunch and dinner here. They also have an excellent selection of coffee and beer. Prices are also very good. Try the Le Monde for breakfast sometime - its my Go-To!

p6Jrece_D-PjCRh_dQoQhg.text: Great ownership, product, and store.  The food is quick and the owner has a particularly good attention to detail.  Looking forward going back.

ZbADDndlhm6IhFci6XzKIg.text: A welcome addition to uptown! Exactly what we needed near the office. The breakfast burritos are so filling that I don't need lunch after one! I've yet to have a sandwich for lunch that I don't like. Have people coming over after work? Grab a bottle of wine and some snacks on your lunch break and you are sorted for the evening. Don't forget to check out the daily sandwich specials!

mOBKPhExN8LTz5tBQFvQIQ.text: Breakfast burritos and coffee from multiple local and small roasters for breakfast.  Sandwiches and daily specials for lunch. Try the chicken torta. Large craft beer selection both small releases and house hold favorite.  Wines champagne and snacks of all types as well. Really just a great spot with friendly staff always there to help ya out!

hp-6WuUxo_yqMw8jP33-_g.text: I rarely give 5 stars. This place is pretty cool. You have a large selection for lunch, though I asked if they had any half/half combos (half sandwich and soup or salad) and they don't. Only potential suggestions. Me and my colleague had a cup of soup (plenty!) and shared a sandwich. Our soups:  butternut squash (tasty but very very sweet) and broccoli cheese (very good). Sandwich was the chicken salad which was good. The vibe is awesome with the music. Choices were abundant. Seating limited so it was good we went well before noon.

uvstIHP1kuFdgxM8j5_yjQ.text: Seriously could not continue to reach this vegetarian goal of mine if it were not for the chaud legumes sammy. It's delish and I can't not order it when I go in even though the whole menu looks tasty.  This place is super cool ta boot. Don't be thrown off by the burger joint over shadowing it on morehead. I love this little place!

LuITBYX5DsMopVNkuAjzaA.text: This place was amazing! Had a delicious bacon egg and cheese sandwich on an English muffin with a cup of great coffee. My only complaint is that it's not on Tryon Street, it's around the corner on church street but it was worth the walk around the block.

vvAO8DtZU9zCvriM_ozd2g.text: Perhaps the best measure of an establishment's customer service is how they respond when things don't go as planned -- which is to be expected from even the best run places. After a small mishap with my order (I was given the wrong person's food, which I didn't discover until I had already returned to my hotel room), Rhino Market not only replaced my sandwich but gave me a gift card which I used to purchase an accompanying spinach salad -- all of which was delicious.  I will be sure to return the next time I'm in Charlotte!

bLkaghz6x4x2943ZU-h_OQ.text: Great market and deli. It's a great place to just hang out with a beer too. Has a funky vibe, especially in the evenings. Love all the sandwiches and great breakfast options too. My favorite is probably the Hot Roast Beef with the Sicilian a close second!

UlsFtVuco1vwlvhuegZaTg.text: Stopped by Rhino Market with some colleagues for lunch and was very impressed! The line moved quickly, my chicken salad sandwich was delicious and the staff were friendly and seemed to be enjoying their jobs. I was also surprised by how reasonable it was - my sandwich with chips and a la croix was barely $10. Amazing beer selection, will have to go back!

pUeZSiM7uRa21f4RcGYsiQ.text: The feel of the place is fantastic and I can't say anything bad about the food either. Both the breakfast and lunch are great. The staff is top notch as well. My only real complaint is that while draft beer prices are fair, packaged beer is pricier here than any other similar store in Charlotte. I'm not paying $15 for a four pack of cans that are $11 or $12 right down the street.

j3si07Mgf6dT7RdQ6_o5Zw.text: Great place. Truly great wine selection for purchase to take home. Several very good deli items. Just salads and sandwiches--not a real restaurant. But a seriously cool place to hang out at large bar.

5yai2VxNCtiFoqsts_9TAA.text: Deli hours are too unreliable. I've headed there too many times and they are closed well within their normal deli hours.

GhataMpXhL71IFsa0NwLvw.text: This cool little market hits all the right buttons for me: nice selection of craft beer and wine, tasty desserts and granola from Cardais Gourmet, fresh bread, unique munchies, creative & delicious kitchen menu (chicken-noodle soup - when available - is fantastic) and fun ~free~ events. Right across the street from Romare Bearden park to top it all off...I'm a regular now!

OCtiUyuvw_-nI80hW8CXbA.text: We've been here for breakfast and lunch and both times, the food was great.  They even had live music.  They have a wide variety of items for sandwiches and salads, or you can create your own!

iOQx5oR7Bzw6Nwkhv88YCQ.text: I cannot get enough of this place!!!The Chaud Legumes sandwich is incredibly flavorful with lots of veggies in it.   My friends really enjoy the Reuben too.   Vast selection of beer, wines and chips to choose from.   The store is open late however I have been there at night and noticed the kitchen was closed... I think it was 9pm. Call ahead to make sure it's open if you're looking for hot food

ZdxgT2WKR1F2Unns0vTd7Q.text: Love this place! I go there almost every day. Amazing drinks, amazing omelettes, amazing chicken salad... I think you get the point here. I higher suggest this place to anyone!

EzAMtY_wyjWxt09R8o-ZzA.text: Vegetarian sandwiches with actual flavor, friendly wines by the glass, no bullsh*t people, and a chill atmosphere. I love this place.  (And gluten free bread if you need some - yay!)

haNMp-3tgW3bVuS_x7xkQg.text: So glad this is walking distance from the office. I went for breakfast, 730 am and there were a couple of people in there but I felt like I beat the rush. So if you want made to order food you order at the window on the right at the middle aisle. You then pay back at the bar and add some coffee (lots of choices) and then pick up your food with your paid receipt at the other window towards the back right of the store. I always worry about the procedural aspects of these markets but this worked smoothly. I ordered the sausage breakfast burrito which was the perfect size. Substantial but not huge. Next time I'd try it without the salsa just because I don't want that little bit of sweetness it provides but it was good either way.

a9tI8Bc7PD9qcaxGzCBn2Q.text: This was fantastic. It has a delicious breakfast burrito that was under 5 bucks. The selection of items as a convenience store was interesting and vast. I was tempted to get some New York Spicy Dill chips but decided against it. I will definitely stop by again.

awUZnhvay-eNg6uQ1zCIQA.text: Best breakfast burrito in Charlotte. And never a long wait. I just wish they were closer to me!

xT0HLjkXmTl80-bgFPXcGA.text: The Uptown Rhino Market & Deli delivers on all fronts. Grab a breakfast burrito, one of my favorites in town, and a cup of coffee for less than $8. Go for lunch and trade in the burrito for any sandwich and a beer. Enjoy the vibe, peruse the aisles of beers and snacks, read a newspaper, do some work. Just chill and enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast burrito

3N1Ng9H2Wz4ANzoBX9UktA.text: I love this market!  Have enjoyed breakfast and lunch here.  The english muffin breakfast sandwich is fabulous!  A generous portion of egg, cheese, and your meat of choice.  Their lunch specials are just as good!  The atmosphere is casual, urban market.  Fun to shop the few aisles of unique food and beverage items!  A must go!  Plus, the owner is from Detroit!

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States

t_B9kCU0KXKg9ZL3egNT4g.text: Stopped by Rhino Market for a much anticipated salad today and was pleasantly surprised by the quality, but the price left a bad taste in my mouth. I purchased a Pollo salad with 1/2 chicken salad and 1/2 egg salad + avocado for a $2.45 up-charge. It was a whole lot of lettuce, three slivers of avocado and two small scoops of chicken/egg salad for a whopping $12.43. If the volume of protein and add-ons increase, I'd be a repeat customer!

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rhino Market left me a hungry, hungry hippo!

9MiKJIsGuQSn1WuDs7JgGA.text: Love the style of this place. They're like a fancy local bodega. They have sandwiches, salads, and all kinds of drinks and snacks. They had great service and the food was yummy. Parking could be difficult but it's a very walkable area.

reH1U-0WUdlYKrrbSkXjrQ.text: I had a Sicilian cold and a beer. The ciabatta bread was incredibly fresh and the sandwich was piled high with meat. I almost didn't want to finish the second half so I could enjoy it later. It's a very well oiled machine and they do a great job handling the rush for lunch. While we were there they cycled through at least 90 orders in about 20-30 minutes.   Very pleasant staff as well and the guy eating the almond butter with a spoon in between cashing people out was a good talking point!    Great place for a quick lunch stop. My only suggestion would be to put chips on both sides of the aisles so if you forget to grab a bag you don't have to fight through the line to grab some. However, it is a mistake you would only make the first time you go.

c8jM25pTtZ6oik1WE1fRRQ.text: The food might be great, but the costumer service is just plain terrible.   Is it Sunday and you want a breakfast burrito? Well, make sure you place your order with the cashier at or before 11:59am, because she knows and follows the rules and they do not serve breakfast in the afternoon.   Is it 12:04pm? Did you ask nicely? Doesn't matter because they definitely do not serve breakfast in the afternoon!   Did she ask the kitchen if they could prepare your breakfast order? Of course not! She has a watch, and if that watch says it's 12:04pm, that means we are already in the afternoon and, guess what, they do not serve breakfast in the afternoon!  Did she do all of the above with a fake smile on her face? Yes, she did. Did that make the whole experience even worse? Most definitely!  To conclude, if you want to interact with emotionless robots, this is the place to go. If you want to interact with human beings and eat breakfast at 12:04 on a Sunday, go to Not Just Coffee a block away. Which is what I'm doing for the rest of the week!

l8iEr5Hfdi1UvO03dco7aw.text: Rhino fills in such a great need for Uptown Charlotte: the local market and deli. It's such a great spot to grab a quick sandwich, stop in for bottle of wine to take home for dinner (from a surprisingly diverse bottled wine and beer selection), or cozy up to the bar and hang out for a while sampling their revolving selection of craft beers. For breakfast or brunch, I absolutely love the Le Monde (egg, sauteed spinach and tomato, melted havarti on rustic sourdough). For lunch, it's the Big Wheel (hot pastrami, swiss, creole mustard, sliced pickles, pumpernickel).

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States

L2VumxiDgOFqXMz5zTmtOw.text: Still enjoy Rhino Market. However, it would be great if they extended breakfast hours on the weekend... I literally just left without a purchase because "breakfast ends at 12p and it was 12:08p. Seems like lost revenue to me!

TSKmDPq6shEAKaBjbw47bg.text: Traveling and looking for something fresh and healthy. My roasted mushrooms and roots bowl hit the spot. Veggies were fresh and crisp. Maine Root sodas were nice for something different, though their root beer is nothing to write home about. Vibe is hip and bright.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roasted Veggie and Root Bowl.

AtJdqGqjOC2rejdGag3qGg.text: This is a place that can do no wrong. The sandwiches are always the best. My go to is the breakfast burrito or the Rueben. Love the wide range of fresh sides or a assortment of chips to go with your sandwich. Then the selection of beer and wine will make you feel like your in heaven. 2 locations just makes it that much sweeter.

6jNgMLZ7NG4PZHSFMcf7Zw.text: Same great rhino market, just another wonderful location! Delicious sandwiches, cold beer and good music. You honestly can't go wrong with any of their food choices- breakfast or lunch - as it's all incredibly fantastic. They also have vegetarian options so it's a win win for everyone. Really excited for their new spot and know anyone that works uptown should check it out!

iG1HuYgR3z40B3eWCpfRKQ.text: Atmosphere is stellar, the food quality I would put at 4 stars. I feel it's a bit overpriced for the food you're getting. Never had any bad service

7hwCvOw1xou0qkHtAaN0Og.text: Tried to go there this evening about 10:55 pm after the Charlotte Knights game for a beer, the door clearly says they are open until midnight, as well as their social media accounts but we were turned away and told they close at 11. If that's the case then change it on your door and on your social media accounts.

1fNNqg_gSZ0bOIexLDWqEg.text: Was in Charlotte for the Half Marathon and as I was walking to the Expo from my hotel, I had my eyes out for a place where I could pick up a quick, healthy lunch, preferably a sandwich. I saw this place as I was walking and based on the reviews, it was Yelp approved.   I've never been to a place like this before (supermarket and deli combo) so walking in I was kind of confused. I saw seating so I was like "Do I just sit down? Will someone come to get my order if I do?" But then I saw other people forming a line towards the back and as I peeked my head in that direction, I saw a small window for orders. I stood in that line and reviewed the menu as I waited. I ordered the turkey sandwich on whole grain which consisted of turkey, cucumber, lettuce, tomato and Dijon vinaigrette. After I ordered, they handed me a hand written receipt and told me to pay up front. It didn't make sense at first. Why couldn't I just pay right there? But I quickly understood that the concept was to give customers the option to buy other items within the market and pay as one total up at the front registers. Ok got it! I did grab a bag of BBQ Lays on my way to the register.   Right after I had paid, I went back to the pickup window and my order was announced within a quick few minutes. After I picked up I looked around to see if there was any open seating. There wasn't and even if there had been, I was once again confused. No one had asked me if this was to-go or takeout. I didn't know if I was allowed to sit in there or if that was for customers who specifically stated that they wanted to eat it there? Again, confusing setup.   So anyways I took my sandwich and chips and threw them in my backpack figuring I'd find a public area to eat. Luckily for me, it worked out well. Less than a block away there was a very pretty seating area outside of the Wells Fargo building. It's right by a pretty water fountain and there are many open tables, mostly filled with downtown (or uptown as it's called in Charlotte) coworkers eating lunch together on a Friday afternoon. I really enjoyed dining there!   As for the sandwich, it was pretty average. Nothing you can't make at home, but it was what I was looking for. Overall, just a tiny step above Subway. I'd recommend this as a decent place to grab a bite to eat with coworkers if you work nearby. Other than that, meeeh. Average meal and semi-confusing setup warrants a 3 rating from me.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey on whole grain. Turkey, lettuce, tomato, cucumber and Dijon vinaigrette. It was ok. Just a small step above Subway.

ZkDyhlSpg1gT1UPQzk8pfQ.text: So much to choose from! I made a quick stop in for lunch with my boyfriend and I was really impressed with the sandwiches we snagged from the window. Generous portions, fresh, and great tasting. We had a nice date in the park across the street. Do it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. One of the best Chicken Salad sandwiches I&#39;ve ever had! Pairs well with BBQ chips :)

EOJ22EitqEjJpjuIHHOUQA.text: This place is a great balance of grocery store and deli. There's an order counter in the back with made from scratch breakfast items, sandwiches, and salads. Both Vegan and regular options. Pay on front and also order drinks and pay anything else up front at register.  Staff is super helpful and friendly.  Local coffee offered with all the variety in fixings  for it. There is indoors and out seating to eat or take items to go. Wi-Fi is free. Can get wine, snacks, and some specialty items here as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Omelette with wheat toast $9
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Order in back at window. Has vegan and normal options.
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cool local coffee flavors

rt1AOFV13XV2AFEGHO2C7Q.text: Rhino Market in downtown Charlotte is a great option for the office lunch goers. I've tried their chicken torta as well as the buffalo tofu sandwich. Both were delicious deli sandwiches. Rhino also has a great selection of beer and wine, as well as their own bar where you can get a good variety of local beers on tap. The staff are super friendly, which makes this a great hangout for grabbing a late lunch and beer while working. They are also happy to give samples of anything on tap so that you can a beer you actually enjoy. I'd come back here anytime when back in Charlotte.

ZNOKk5yJs9tBLzPNfoTdYQ.text: Was going here once or twice a week for breakfast. Food is great, staff of awful. Inattentive to patrons, texting while waiting on customers, & generally unfriendly and rude. Took it down to one star. This place has to find better staff behind the register. Gave it another shot and the same rude attitude.

Jz6pS0S5uSVAG7QD31Z9tA.text: An Uptown favorite!  Many reasons to drop in if you have not already.  Great selection of wine, snacks, and drinks to purchase.  They have excellent made to order sandwiches and salads, they also have Breakfast.  They have a good selection of games for guests to play as well while enjoying a drink at that bar.

CYCv3wSgEp3ROCohykbuVQ.text: Often imitated, never duplicated. Although this is the first "imitation", had all the same amazingness of the original from the great craft beer selection to the deli menu and awesome, friendly staff. Eric, the night manager, introduced himself to my wife and I within five minutes of us entering.   Can't wait to see the evolution of the new store. Congrats to Ron and the team!

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States

MhrwG-sa64tmicIponme_g.text: Two words. Chaud Legumes. It's hands down one of my favorite lunch sandwiches in the CLT.   The ciabatta it's served in is super soft and delicious. The caramelized veggies (zucchini, peppers, onions) are cooked to perfect. And the mozzarella is oh my!!!   I've compared this sandwich to the fan fav, the chicken torta, and they don't even compare. Although the torta is still very good.   So long story short: even if you're a meat lover you gotta try the Chaud Legumes. I promise you won't regret it!!

EIPZSASp7TiELuoTeSY9fg.text: I seriously had a revelation as I was about to write my review on Rhino Market, my parents had a convenient store when I was a kid and sitting in Rhino, gives me the same feeling as sitting in my dad's business, but you too can enjoy Rhino Market even if your parents didn't own Island Grocery. Here are my top reasons! 1. RETAIL DRINKING! Love, love, love paying retail for wine. No need for explanation.  2. Great sandwiches and salads, made with love, reasonable pricing and you can eat healthy while you cancel it out with a bottle of bubbles. 3. Self serve coffee, locally roasted and freshly brewed. 4. Location, location, location, I always find parking on the street. 5. Beer Mecca. If you haven't been, go check it out and pretend you're sitting in my parent's store.

Eoeyd70jMVmC8SuNAbURHg.text: A unique unsuspecting brunch spot, Rhino's appears at first to be a convenience style store with many shelves of food and drink. However, if you press on, you find a counter where you can pick up breakfast and lunch quickly. Excellent for professionals on the go, this store delivered a delicious sandwich for a very low price. 5 stars for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. English Muffin Sandwich
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. English Muffin Sandwich

ZPkIk9PHNGZMk28KIyGrfg.text: Cool place, has the allure of a coffee shop but acts as more of a deli. Food is fantastic, ordered the Sicilian Cold and the chicken tortilla soup. Both excellent. Service is quick. Employees are nice, you can tell they enjoy working here. I'll definitely visit this place again when I come back to Charlotte. Next time I'll try their wide array of coffee and beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sicilian (Cold)

6X1hHt410684iqTvzY8r8g.text: If you're looking for the BEST homemade soup in Charlotte, look no further. The soup choices change on a daily basis, and if you discover that they're offering your favorite you better order it early on before it sells out.  They are that good!!!! Some of my favorites include carrot ginger, sweet potato bisque, lentil curry, and my all-time fav is sweet potato pumpkin (please bring this one back soon!).  The local coffee, rotating draft beers, delicious sandwiches, and breakfast items (the french toast with homemade jam and warm maple syrup is two thumbs up!!) that are served daily make Rhino Market my favorite local spot in uptown Charlotte.

0D3HznLW6QaFanNx8FeqWg.text: For the most part Rhino Market & Deli sandwich's and salads (visited on three separate occasions) are good and are served at competitive price points. Their operation is well organized and they get you out with your order in a decent amount time (even during rush hour). Additionally, their location to BB&T Park makes it an excellent spot to meet up with friends for a quick cold draft beer on your way to a ball game during the upcoming spring & summer.

eyHH5bvi0bl0PjNFSLQCkw.text: Very friendly service, beer on tap, games, and an enjoyable atmosphere! What more could you ask for??

WV8ucaIIRPnbK6YAgoySzw.text: Rhino Deli Uptown and Morehead St. never disappoint. I enjoy Breakfast at either one every weekend I am in town. The service is always good and the employees are friendly. I think everyone should try it.

2YBbABo-xXptF8gnKA2C9g.text: This is a groovy joint. I say groovy because I'm writing this review as I sit at the RM bar listening to 60s R&B. I have my laptop on WiFi and plugged in to the super convenient/considerate power outlet (the bar has several) as I enjoy a breakfast burrito and cup of coffee. Groovy seems like an appropriate descriptor.   I'm a neighbor of the original Morehead location so Rhino's concept was not new to me. You have the same delicious food, wide selection of beverages, and inviting atmosphere. What's great about the uptown location is that it's a nice change of pace to the usual uptown rest stops. Uptown has plenty of coffee shops, delis, bars, and convenient stores. But Rhino is the only place the combines them in to one (and does it well).   If you are in for breakfast, try the burrito! For lunch, the tofu you sandwich! Have a coffee, have a beer, have a coke, or whatever. You can't go wrong, there really is something for everyone here.

vNIYm6GSSwsjITKOyL8p9A.text: I used to frequent this place on a regular basis ... bring folks there... ( $$$$) have meetings there ...sometimes I'd be there daily ...but no more ...food is still good and there are some folks that work there that are really fantastic ( some of the great employees have left as well so the shift is even more prevalent ) so if you do decide to go fine ...this review is based on customer service atmosphere and my and my friends experiences ...so instead of writing a novel I'll break it down simply:  1. An employee ( a friend of the owner ) was disrespectful to me , other regulars and the staff on several occasions . When it came to me personally the other employees apologized for what he did ( not even going to relay what it was because it still makes me mad )  because they knew me and when he finally came back after the staff said hey you messed up he got mad when I was talking to him ... so he still thought he was right. This also goes with my number 2 and 3 . No repercussions ( friend of the owner )  2. An employee advised I could get a beer because the taps were closing soon ( mind you I had a few friends with me and one was there from incident 1 listed. So another employee when going to the bar walks up to me in my personal space ( like way too close ) and said taps are closed . Which wouldn't had been an issue but they way it was done ( the disrespectful pseudo intimidation  ) which I laughed off because he really didn't want to go there... and it was silly ..my friends were like ... " you know him ? " I stated no my first time seeing him ..are they teaching the new staff to be terrible ?   3. The owner had a dispute with one of the vendors and called him a black mutherf*****  in the store ( the vendor was not there ) some of those staff members were ethnic and they heard it of course ...while I heard he apologized later .... anyone who is comfortable enough to do that has said and done much worse about staff , customers etc in private. And the tolerance for bad behavior.  There are other issues some told to me and I've experienced but the last 3 really sealed the deal. They benefitted from common market closing uptown and failed to understand what made that place great. Oh and too cheap fir heaters outside... ( thought I'd throw that in too )   I wish well to the good folks that still work there but I will not ,unless there are mitigating circumstances ,support this business.

y2sNZzK8gQMjkFGJS32N2A.text: Such a cool deli and in a wonderful location! They have a great and healthy selection of cold salads, regular deli items and wine and beer. We picked up cold sesame noodle salad and lentil salad which was delicious! Great place for a quick pick me up!

dLbTvO-6jKcLGu_IREbhww.text: I would say that this place has a really cool vibe.  We came on a Thursday and they had a live dj in the building.  So there's a store and then the deli in the back.  We ordered two Chicken Torta's (one on sourdough bread - toasted and the other one on a poppy seed bagel).  The sandwich would've been amazing (it had all the right ingredients on it) but the chicken was unseasoned and large (cut in big pieces, I would've liked it shredded).  If those two were aligned, then I could've given that sandwich and the experience overall a 5.  Other than that, the customer service was good - no complaints there.  We said we would return to try something new from their menu and give it another shot so we shall see upon our return.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Torta

qeo_k1Y3IWSA1jR07JsJ2A.text: John and I have been pumped about the new Rhino ever since the announcement was made about a second location. Go figure, this location did not disappoint! When we walked in, we were immediately greeted by Eric. All the staff are so friendly and I love that they offer the same, trusty selection of beer, wine, and other beverages. I ordered the chili and it was had great flavor and was very meaty/hearty. This location's bar is bigger, which I liked. I also love that they maintain their eclectic wall coverings, which works for Rhino. If you haven't been here, check it out! I think the only downside is parking, but that's to be expected Uptown.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rhino!

vq1VT-y_u20l5qwtMf-Aww.text: This Rhino market location is small but it's packed full of great deli sandwiches, an awesome selection of snacks, beer, wine, and even gifts.   There is a bar with beer and wine by the glass, and indoor/outdoor seating.   It's the perfect place to grab stuff for a picnic in Romare Bearden park during live music Wednesday!

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States

Z2WjrrHbmGxEE_n3tIZRoQ.text: We've been to the original Rhino market location, but not this one. We were uptown looking for some dessert after dinner nearby so we stopped by here.  I love the Rhino Market concept. It's a great place to hang out. Drinks, grocery snacks, sandwiches. This one is no different.   We found a few good options. We ended up getting a lemon blueberry white chocolate cookie (Sweet Girl) and an ice cream sandwich. Both were great.   This is definitely a good place to come hang out for a while and grab something to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ice cream sandwich
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon blueberry white chocolate cookie

5U678J4A4-UTI0DscSYu0w.text: I stopped by here while waiting for a friend since I was starving and had heard good things about this place. It is like a convenience store while a small sandwich shop at the back. I order the roast beef sandwich and grabbed some chips. Prices were reasonable which was nice. The sandwich itself was just ok. It lacked flavor, so I added a few condiments on it to add a bit of flavor and it was much better. I like the space and would visit again to order different sandwich.

WWEvcNfcd8EBoyG6VDq2ag.text: Rhino Market Is a cool little spot that is nestled in the heart of Charlotte. It offers several options and choices for everyone. They do have a deli counter to order food such as sandwiches, salads and soups. Everyday they offer a special sandwich that changes and a vast variety of drinks, chips and snacks. I went for lunch today and ordered a chicken torta and found the sandwich very basic. I was expecting more spices and exciting flavors, but instead it was a plain chicken breast with cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, avocado and jalapenos. I will say that this was not my favorite sandwich and would have to give it another go.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States

jF7pRLRo3xBR7fCO5SWnZA.text: Came in to past the time and have some breakfast. The breakfast burrito is filling and really hit the spot. I normally prefer my cheese melted but the cheddar was sliced and it worked really well not melted. I enjoyed every bite!  The setup is cool too. Tables for eating, meeting others or to just do work. Plenty of snacks, a nice selection of craft beers and really clean.  Great customer service and the music created a cool vibe. I'd definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States

8cjAZvT29ZAMrbfwXk7Csg.text: Rhino deli is a great place to grab breakfast or lunch any day of the week. It is hard to find breakfast for under $5 or lunch for under $10 anywhere uptown so this makes it a special gem.   The market is also amazing with anything from wine, craft beer, kombucha, muffins, snacks and even Girl Scout cookies! With the exception of the cookies, there is a considerable markup on those products but the convenience softens the blow.   The cashiers are always very friendly, and even if there is a line, the chefs in the back move quickly.   If you are lucky, they even have live music on some days.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuesday Special: Pecan Pesto Turkey

ghaTmckT90_peyBYBNOEYQ.text: Was staying near by at the Kimpton and was so happy to have found this place. They have good food for breakfast (Burrito) and lunch and the desserts were a nice little extra.  The ABLT is a really good sandwich and they do not skimp on anything. My wife had the Spinach Bacon salad and really enjoyed it. Overall a great little market that I would recommend if you ever need to pick up some food.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch on the go before a wedding.

jZhzU9-zzxtIh4BJqt8hVg.text: I'm in love with this place..   Ambiance: 5/5 nice cozy with everything you need for a nice gathering.. little area for us girls to sit so we can colors and gossips. Nice music with a DJ. And he's cute so that's a great touch..   Food: 5/5 I ordered a chicken salad sandwich. Freshly made to order on a sour bread. And I also brought a huge bag of cheese popcorns..   The store is filled with all kinds of wines, bubbles, beers, beers on tap. They even have wines on tap. Coffee to order.. I meet this is perfect.. and it's not expensive.   Overall, it's a grocery store with a bartender and a barista on hand. There's an area on the back that can make sandwiches to order.. and tops icing on the cake is nice music with a DJ in the back group.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Barista and bartender
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Area to order sandwiches

kxeEtHGX40S76rf_v5n-nw.text: So excited to see another Rhino location.  I've always loved the Moorehead location and glad to see some of our Charlotte favs moving into the Uptown area as more condos and apartment buildings become available.  Right off of Church Street, this location is across from Romeare Bearden Park and is a nice addition to the little strip (along with JJ's and B.Good).  Just a stones throw away from Latta Arcade.  The new location is not as "lived in" as the Moorehead location, but I"m sure it will be in time.  There are a bunch of tables, some limited outdoor seating and a full bar located in the middle of all the action.  The aisles with all the food stuffs are in the middle and the kitchen off to the right.  Moor drink coolers line the back walls but it really is a cool place to sit down, have breakfast, or grab a sandwich.  I would be curious to see what their lunch rush would look like since there should be a lot of uptown workers coming through.  My last visit here, I did a saturday event at BB&T Ballpark and then walked up here to grab a delicious omelete.  It was also pride weekend, so the store was decked out with rainbow banners across the bar seating.  The staff here are super nice and it's just a relaxed place to hang out.  I definitely love their french toast.... well basically all their breakfast items available on the menu.  Confession:  it was 9am and I had a beer, but hey, it WAS Saturday.

LRH6u9_HqOiInidmNm-fRA.text: I ordered the breakfast burrito with extra sausage. The burrito was a nice size and was filling. I also purchased a fruit bowl out of the refrigerator which came with pineapples, grapes, blueberries and strawberries.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States

9fIfQPOudZmWLHZZrob1KA.text: Rhino market is simply amazing.  This place has it all. It's the new hip trendy kind of place that is here to stay.  When you walk in your senses are transcended into another dimension.  You don't know where to look first.  Do you check out the awesome craft coffee selection? Or perhaps you want to belly up to the bar for a cold craft beer. Hungry? Slide back past the isles of awesome wine and craft beer to the deli and place your order for some really good artisan sandwiches.  Grab a seat, a beer, or coffee and enjoy the atmosphere.  Before you leave browse the many natural and organic products.  There is something for everyone. They carry environmentally conscious products with healthy vibes.  We bought a ton of hard to find craft beer to take home and also had a couple sandwiches on several visits to this location over a couple days. The staff are always so helpful and courteous.  You know when a place is doing it right and this place is certainly doing it right.

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hours
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer

YK0egvzcwKuGdt6_69JJ6g.text: This place will never take the place of the original in my mind, but it's a close second! It still has the urban market and kitschy homey vibe of the first Rhino, but it's a bit more open and modern. They still have the shelves full of beer, wine and snacks and an awesome deli menu and amazing coffee, but the feel is just different. The seating was plentiful but definitely more geared towards a lunch crowd (lots of small tables all in a line) vs. the original which offers a wider variety of seating types and has a cozy factor that makes you want to stay and work awhile.   I like the location of uptown Rhino, which is very convenient to the museums, Romare Bearden Park, and many of the offices. However, due to its urban-ness, parking is hard to come by. Street parking is your best bet, but there isn't a lot. It's also metered, so during the day, it costs.   We went on a Monday evening around 7pm and found out it was trivia night! We didn't play, but were able to carry on a conversation while it was going on since it wasn't crazy busy or overbearingly loud. There was good energy and I would definitely go back with a group :)

v23qjp9fnlP_5c4JJCWEeg.text: So, I only visited this location to hang out with some friends, but it was a good time.   The parking wasn't hard at all because there's a deck right behind it. Totally convenient. I rode the elevator down and walked right inside. Perfect for a rainy day or cold weather.  They had plenty of good wine offerings, the food that my friends ordered looked delicious (but I didn't try any), they have lots of fun snacks, the music was enjoyable and there was plenty of space for us to spread out and chill for a bit.   If you're in the area and looking for a cool place to just sit around for a bit, this is a great option.

J2KaxazZPOVCKrH0btmHKw.text: The English muffin with egg, peppar jack cheese, and brown sugar bacon is EVERYTHING!!

Ef-ZSsI1yKzpM0vX1LhxNQ.text: They have nitro cold brew on tap here. Enough said. I skip the long line at Starbucks in the morning and walk here instead. No line, friendly people and delicious nitro cold brew.  I love the concept of the place and although I don't drink they have beer specials as well as breakfast foods and sandwiches they prepare to order. They even have a water bowl for your fury friends outside!

Goq-AClwPelDIbeIz2wrsA.text: I went here on Wednesday around 4pm. Wasn't very busy. I've heard good things about the food, but didn't really understand how it works. I sat at the bar by myself and kind of looked around confused. Is it a grocery store? Is it a restaurant? Is it a bar? I know what the name of the place says so DUH.....so if you want to eat there you go and order from the window and they give you a number that they yell out when ready.  The music is the right volume and a good vibe. I def could not hear my order number though from where I was sitting. The bartender got it for me.  Beers were on special for $3.50 if it was under 5% alcohol content.  They have a couch and other seats as well not at the bar. Not a ton of seating.  They have daily specials, live music on certain nights.  As far as the food I got, it was good. I only ordered the portobello sandwich and it was good.  I only saw a few people working but they were all nice. I was there about a hour and some customers came in to by six packs of beer. I'll go back

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. On tap
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Portobello
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. $3.50

dOj48IykTkVaWy3eaGfzaQ.text: This uptown location is just as cool as the other location. I was leaving an event in uptown and was able to stop in and get my Enderly Coffee before heading home.   Easy staff, great selection.

nXqrhKERO5jmAwcxtB_WYg.text: I dig a good deli / market & was so happy that Rhino has another location near my job. Thankfully, a fellow Yelper took pics of the menu, so I could check ahead of my visit & decide what to get. Who loves a good Reuben?! ME! So I decided to go with this lovely sandwich for my first visit. I don't know why I decided to get a medium sized bag of pork rinds, because when my sandwich came out, I knew I wasn't going to be able to eat everything!  Heaping mounds of beef & sauerkraut - YUM! The bread was so good, too! Decent sized sandwich!  Plenty of snack & beverage choices in the market. Friendly employees & good prices!

ploIAPO88kuDMyFM1URh6w.text: Truly a top notch market and deli with so many local goods. My husband and I love this place and come here pretty much on a daily basis. Awesome breakfast sandwiches (I love the Le Monde on toasted wheat, he loves the egg bacon cheddar on an English muffin) and lunch/ dinner sandwich menu. Several vegetarian options as well as daily soup rotation with house veggie available daily. Very solid wine and beer selection and a cozy spot to grab a local draft beer after work. Did I mention they carry King of Pops (including Pup Cups for our furry friends), Golden Cow Creamery, and Pasta and Provisions?! Every staff member is so friendly and truly seem happy to work there. My only wish is that they had a rewards system!

photos.caption: Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey Sammy from the menu
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rhino Market & Deli - Charlotte, NC, United States. Protein bars

gHkMMbSes9rWZc6WMRyLKw.text: This is 3.5 stars for me, rounding up to 4.  The concept of rhino market is really appealing!  They have a variety of beverages, serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  They play fun music and have eclectic products.  The food Is ok, nothing special, and a little overpriced.  The chicken torta is the best sandwich, but for me it's too much bread and not enough ingredients.    It's in a convenient location which is a plus.  The staff is really friendly.
